Evaluation_Questions: Overall, how would you rate the workload of this course in comparison to other Yale courses you have taken
What is your overall assessment of this course
What is your overall rating of the primary instructor
The primary instructor's provided students with helpful and timely feedback
The instructor established a positive learning environment
The instructor raised questions or problems that encouraged me to think critically
Comments_Questions: Indicate the total number of hours per week (outside the classroom) you spent on this course
Looking back on this course, what is your overall assessment of the course:  What are its strengths and weaknesses, and in what ways might it be improved
Please evaluate the instructor of this course. What are the instructor's strengths and weaknesses, and in what ways might his or her teaching be improved?
How would you summarize this course for a fellow student?  Would you recommend it to another student?  Why or why not
Comments_List:
strength: perfect for students pursuing a career as traditional biostatistician working with investigators.

weakness: the content is too narrow, restricted and not as valuable for majority of students who are not pursuing a career as traditional biostatistician working with investigators.
the course seems to come out to just scratch the surface of epidemiology and clinical trial combined.
 
may consider to make this course only a core requirement for PhD/MD students.

Very helpful for students who want to be biostatisticians. 
But the class schedule is not well organized.

Strengths: helpful in improving communication skills
Weaknesses: too much contents

A useful and interesting course. Just want to thank all four instructors, they really prepared a lot and want to teach us some real things. 
The course is actually very helpful to bridge somewhat gap between school and real work situation with useful methods/ guidelines.
Look forward to the next semester :)
The course is not structured well. It doesn't provide much useful information. It could be improved by including more materials related to skills required for a job in industry.
strength: know the whole page of statistical consulting

strength: a great introduction to biostatisticians and their career life
weakness: this course might have nothing to do with some students' future life

This class was terrible. The focus was very limited (only clinical trials and observational studies and nothing about health informatics, computational biology, collaborating with biologists, or machine learning). The workload was tedious and not helpful. Most of the material was repetitive and already covered in Epidemiology and Clinical Trials. Prof. Peduzzi was also not a very nice teacher and his lectures and explanations never made any sense. Overall this class was a waste of time and I hope they get rid of it.
some topics are not necessary to learn, such as communication skills
The course is not suitable for students from the US and with work experience. It would be more valuable to substitute this course for one more challenging and/or make this class optional.
She is very logical and clear
The instructor is good and helpful.
The instructor is good and helpful.
The instructor is good and helpful.
Lisa is nice and always there to help.
The instructor is good and helpful.
Not a nice professor. His answers to questions were often snide and a little obnoxious, and his explanations and lectures did not make much sense.
experienced, but not straightforward in teaching, sometimes unclear

yes for students pursuing a career as traditional biostatistician working with investigators
no for other students
The course is not practice in a sense for students who want to work in industry.
This course takes a lot of time and I have no idea what I learned in this class. If this course is not required, I will not take it for sure.
Yes, I would like to recommend this course

This class was terrible. The focus was very limited (only clinical trials and observational studies and nothing about health informatics, computational biology, collaborating with biologists, or machine learning). The workload was tedious and not helpful. Most of the material was repetitive and already covered in Epidemiology and Clinical Trials. Prof. Peduzzi was also not a very nice teacher and his lectures and explanations never made any sense. Overall this class was a waste of time and I hope they get rid of it.
